place.desc: A Roman province including the Sinai peninsula and Roman territory east of the Jordan River.
An ancient port on the coast of Phoenice, and the last Crusader foothold in the Levant.
A city on the Seyhan River in south-eastern Anatolia, near the Mediterranean coast.
An ancient and medieval port on the coast of Cilicia.
A town on the northwestern coast of Lake Van in eastern Anatolia.
A major city in northern Syria.
A village in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
A town in the mountains of northern Iraq, east of the Tigris.
The eastern major river of Mesopotamia, flowing from SE Turkey to the Persian Gulf.
An ancient town east of the Jordan River, now the capital of Jordan.
A village in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
A town east of the Tigris and north of the Great Zab in northern Iraq.
A Hellenistic city near Apamea, now called al-Rastan.
A river of eastern Anatolia which flows from north of Lake Van into the Euphrates above Melitene.
A village in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
A mountainous region southeast of Lake Van.
A diocese of the Church of the East, also known as Elam, centered around Beth Lapaṭ.

place.desc: A village in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
A city east of the Jordan River in the Roman province of Arabia.
The capital of the Abbasid caliphate and modern Iraq.
A city northwest of Mosul on the Tigris.
A tributary of the Euphrates that enters it at al-Raqqa.
A city in southern Iraq.
A port city on the coast of Lebanon.
A village southwest of Mardin.
An ancient city where Jacob of Serugh was bishop.
A village in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
A region west of the Caspian Sea, encompassing the modern country of Azerbaijan and the provinces of northwest Iran.
A village on the Euphrates north of Mabbug and south of Samosata.
A mountain north of Damascus.
A port city between Beirut and Tripolis.
A port city in Palaestina north of Gaza.
A Roman province in central Anatolia.
An Anatolian coastal region north of Antioch.
A Roman province of coastal Anatolia with its capital at Tarsos.
A Roman province of coastal Anatolia with its capital at Anazarbos.
The capital of the Parthian and Sasanian Empires, on the east bank of the Tigris.
A city in Cappadocia, modern Kayseri.
A large inland sea north of Iran and east of Adharbayjān.
A city at the confluence of the Euphrates and the Khabur rivers.
A city across the Bosphorus from Constantinople, the site of an ecumenical council in 451.
A city southeast of Melitene.
A city of south-central Anatolia.
An ancient and medieval city 70 km north of Aleppo.
A village in modern Syria near the Euphrates.
A diocese of the Church of the East, whose bishop was a suffragan of the Metropolitan of Beth Huzaye.
A hermitage in the hills aboveDayr al-Zaʿfarān.
An ancient city and capital of the Umayyad Caliphate.
A Roman city between Mardin and Nisibis.
A medieval region east of Edessa and north of Harran, mentioned in Arabic chronicles from the Crusader period.
A monastery near Mardin, the seat of a Syrian Orthodox patriachate from 1293 into the 20th C.
A vilayet of the Ottoman Empire created from a portion of Diyarbakir vilayet.
The Roman province of Egypt
A monastery near Qeleth in Ṭur ʿAbdin.

place.desc: A monastery near Midyat in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
A monastery near Ṣalaḥ in Ṭur ʿAbdin, seat of the Syrian Orthodox patriarchate of Ṭur ʿAbdin from 1365.
A monastery overlooking Dayr al-Zaʿfarān outside Mardin, dedicated to the Virgin Mary and St. Theodore.
A Roman town in the province of Isauria.
A town west of the Euphrates, north of Aleppo, and northeast of Cyrrhus.
A town in northern Iraq north of Alqosh and southeast of Zakho.
A Parthian and Roman border town on the Euphrates.
A city ofMesopotamia, the capital of the ancient kingdom ofOsrhoene, modern Urfa.
A Roman province on the west bank of the Euphrates from above Samosata to Circesium.
A Roman town in Cilicia II near the head of the Gulf of Iskenderun.
The western major river of Mesopotamia, flowing from eastern Turkey to the Persian Gulf.
A city in New Jersey, USA.
A state of the USA.
A country in northwestern Europe.
A city in Cilicia, a provincial capital of the Roman Empire and for a time the capital of the Armenian Kingdom of Cilicia.
A city in Belgium
A church in Ḥimṣ.
